intro: Cynoglossum wildii, commonly known as wild forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue or violet flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Cynoglossum wildii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
